repository.name: electron
repository.description: :electron: Build cross-platform desktop apps with JavaScript, HTML, and CSS

body:
I'm not sure the #3420 fix completely fixed this issue.  I think I can achieve the same effect by also calling `event.preventDefault()` in the `page-title-updated` handler.  Doing that happens to fix my reduced test case, but it does not fix the original application code that I started with.  FWIW, here's the stack trace from my application, after adding `event.preventDefault()`:

```
Program received signal SIGSEGV, Segmentation fault.
0x00007ffff0fe169e in content::NavigationControllerImpl::GetEntryAtOffset(int) const () from /home/rprichard/XXX/electron/out/D/libcontent.so
(gdb) bt
#0  0x00007ffff0fe169e in content::NavigationControllerImpl::GetEntryAtOffset(int) const () from /home/rprichard/XXX/electron/out/D/libcontent.so
#1  0x00007ffff11f8500 in content::WebContentsImpl::UpdateTitle(content::RenderFrameHost*, int, std::basic_string<unsigned short, base::string16_char_traits, std::allocator<unsigned short> > const&, base::i18n::TextDirection) () from /home/rprichard/XXX/electron/out/D/libcontent.so
#2  0x00007ffff0feed42 in content::RenderFrameHostImpl::OnMessageReceived(IPC::Message const&) () from /home/rprichard/XXX/electron/out/D/libcontent.so
#3  0x00007ffff1120fce in content::RenderProcessHostImpl::OnMessageReceived(IPC::Message const&) () from /home/rprichard/XXX/electron/out/D/libcontent.so
#4  0x00007ffff6007a72 in IPC::ChannelProxy::Context::OnDispatchMessage(IPC::Message const&) () from /home/rprichard/XXX/electron/out/D/libipc.so
#5  0x00007ffff5edb018 in base::debug::TaskAnnotator::RunTask(char const*, char const*, base::PendingTask const&) () from /home/rprichard/XXX/electron/out/D/libbase.so
#6  0x00007ffff5efa081 in base::MessageLoop::RunTask(base::PendingTask const&) () from /home/rprichard/XXX/electron/out/D/libbase.so
#7  0x00007ffff5efa239 in base::MessageLoop::DeferOrRunPendingTask(base::PendingTask const&) () from /home/rprichard/XXX/electron/out/D/libbase.so
#8  0x00007ffff5efa4ad in base::MessageLoop::DoWork() () from /home/rprichard/XXX/electron/out/D/libbase.so
#9  0x00007ffff5ecd269 in base::MessagePumpGlib::Run(base::MessagePump::Delegate*) () from /home/rprichard/XXX/electron/out/D/libbase.so
#10 0x00007ffff5f11e40 in base::RunLoop::Run() () from /home/rprichard/XXX/electron/out/D/libbase.so
#11 0x00007ffff0f4d8eb in content::BrowserMainLoop::MainMessageLoopRun() () from /home/rprichard/XXX/electron/out/D/libcontent.so
#12 0x00007ffff0f4d830 in content::BrowserMainLoop::RunMainMessageLoopParts() () from /home/rprichard/XXX/electron/out/D/libcontent.so
#13 0x00007ffff0f505fd in ?? () from /home/rprichard/XXX/electron/out/D/libcontent.so
#14 0x00007ffff0f48f43 in content::BrowserMain(content::MainFunctionParams const&) () from /home/rprichard/XXX/electron/out/D/libcontent.so
#15 0x00007ffff0ed9d31 in ?? () from /home/rprichard/XXX/electron/out/D/libcontent.so
#16 0x00007ffff0ed8cb0 in content::ContentMain(content::ContentMainParams const&) () from /home/rprichard/XXX/electron/out/D/libcontent.so
#17 0x000000000076ee4a in main (argc=2, argv=0x7fffffffdcc8) at ../../atom/app/atom_main.cc:179
```

I suppose I could try to update my test case...
@rprichard i am unable to reproduce the crash after the fix with the test case, it would really help if you could reduce your application scenario to a minimal test case, thanks!

issue.title: Delay the page-title-updated event to next tick

repository.name: electron
repository.description: :electron: Build cross-platform desktop apps with JavaScript, HTML, and CSS

issue.body:
Similar to #3643, Chromium is doing something with webContents after the `page-title-updated` event, so if users close the window during it a crash will happen.

Fix #3380.
